Verses.1: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God,
Verses.2:
as it is written in Isaiah the prophet:
"Behold! I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
Who will prepare your way.
Verses.3:
The voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
'Prepare the way of the LORD.
Make His paths straight!'"
Verses.4: John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness preaching baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Verses.5: And all of the Judean countryside and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem went out to him. They were being baptized by Him in the Jordan river, and confessing their sins.
Verses.6: John wore clothing made of camels hair with a leather belt around his waist. His diet was locusts and wild honey.
Verses.7: He was preaching, saying, "After me, One is coming who is mightier than me. I am unworthy to bend down and untie the strap of His sandals.
Verses.8: I baptize you in water, but He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit."
Verses.9: In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
Verses.10: As soon as Jesus came up out of the water, he saw the heavens splitting apart and the Holy Spirit, like a dove, descending upon Him.
Verses.11: Then a voice came from the heavens, "You are My beloved Son, in you I am well pleased."
Verses.12: Immediately, the Spirit brought Him out into the wilderness.
Verses.13: For forty days, He was in the wilderness being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and the angels sustained his life.
Verses.14: After John was taken into custody, Jesus went into Galilee. He was proclaiming the gospel of God.
Verses.15: He said, "The time has come. The kingdom of God has drawn near. Repent and believe in the gospel!"
Verses.16: As Jesus was going along the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon. They were casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
Verses.17: Jesus called out to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people."
Verses.18: Immediately, they left their nets and followed Him.
Verses.19: After going a little further, He saw James, the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat, mending their nets.
Verses.20: Immediately, He called them. The brothers left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired workers, and followed him.
